channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Quarantine classifications will be implemented for a month — Palace
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Quarantine classifications would now be implemented for a month to make it easier to impose localized lockdowns and to have more stability in the enforcement of pandemic containment measures, Malacañang said Tuesday.

item.title: Senate recommends criminal, admin cases vs PhilHealth execs
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: The Senate in its Committee of the Whole report recommended that the Department of Justice take legal action against current and former PhilHealth executives such as ex-chief Ricardo Morales, Health Secretary Francisco Duque III, former SVP Rodolfo del Rosario, and more.

item.title: Ex-NBI chief Gierran can conduct investigations, is 'best choice' to lead PhilHealth — Palace
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: "The problem with Philhealth is corruption so the president thought the best person to appoint is one who is capable of conducting investigations," Roque said.

item.title: Revolutionary gov't proposal important for public discourse, Roque says
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "The president's position remains that a revolutionary government is not what we need in these times...but if there are any citizens or sectors who hold resentment and strongly feel that revolutionary government can solve their problems, then that is where the need for public discourse."

item.title: Cascolan named PNP chief as Gamboa retires — Año
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "Cascolan brings with him the occupational specialty in command and control, honed by vast experience in field operations and strategic management," Banac's statement reads.

item.title: Teachers, school administrators file 31st petition vs anti-terrorism law
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: A group of professors, school administrators, teachers, and teacher-unionists on Tuesday filed the 31st legal challenge to the controversial Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020.

item.title: COVID-19 cases climb past 224,000 as Metro Manila stays under GCQ
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte kept partial restrictions in the capital region for a month starting Tuesday. Other areas under GCQ include Bulacan, Batangas, Tacloban City in Eastern Visayas and Bacolod City in Western Visayas.

item.title: Citing killing of Zara Alvarez, Karapatan presses SC to grant protection writs
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: On Tuesday, the rights monitor filed a manifestation before the SC stating the "rampant red-tagging and terrorist-labeling of human rights defenders in the Philippines has led to their harassment, incarceration on false charges or even killings."

item.title: 'All-out': Task force vows tighter curfew enforcement amid GCQ extension
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: “Curfew must be enforced regardless of the existing community quarantine status. Containing the unnecessary movement and gathering of people even within a community is part of the general medical solution against COVID-19 since what we are after is the prevention of the spread of this deadly virus,” said Police Lt. Gen. Guillermo Eleazar, commander of the task force.

item.title: Duterte says P1-billion college aid allotted for children of OFWs displaced by COVID-19
item.description: "The education subsidy will be given to one college level beneficiary from a qualified OFW enrolled or is intending to enroll in state universities and colleges, local universities and colleges, and [Commission on Higher Education]- recognized private higher education institutions in this school year 2020 [to 2021]," Duterte said.
